data.description:
Take part in the Pokedex Challenge and become the Champion!

You've received a call from the legendary Professor Oak, and he has an important task for you - complete the Pokedex! Catch wild Pokemon as they pop up in your timeline and collect their data. You'll only become champion if you catch 'em all!

Directions
•Pokemon will appear at random times throughout the day
•You can only catch one Pokemon at a time
•If multiple Pokemon pop up at once, or if it's been a while since you've seen one (>12 hours), you can re-populate them by opening the app from the menu

Controls
•When the wild Pokemon notification pops up, click Select and choose 'More' to reveal the Pokemon
•From this screen, click Select again and choose 'Catch!' (the Pokedex will automatically open to their new entry)
•Then, click Back twice to exit the Pin and Notification to reveal the Pokedex

•To navigate, use the Up or Down buttons
•To skip blank entries and navigate to the next caught Pokemon entry, simply hold Up or Down
•To see data on height and weight, click Select
•To see your Trainer Card, which shows Pokedex progress and game duration, long hold Select

Misc
•Think you have what it takes to be the best? Post pictures of your trainer card in the official Pokedex Challenge thread on the Pebble forums or reddit to get added to the leaderboards!
•As always, if you love it, give it a <3 and thanks for playing!

Credits
•Forked from Buchenherz's "Pokedex Kanto", which was built off of shutdown27's original "Pebble Pokedex"
•No official relation to Nintendo/Game Freak

data.description:
Simple Pebble.JS (Javascript only) app to fetch data from IBM BlueMix. The data is provided from a TI SensorTag via the IoT Foundation to a Node Red application.

As the app expects a simple response from a web site in the form of a JSON structure, it can potentially be used for any site that provides data in an appropriate form.  The latest version of the app allows you to configure your own URL.  Data consumed by the app from the BlueMix site at present looks like the following:-

{
  "gyro_x": "-3.64",
  "ambient_temp": "24.03",
  "gyro_y": "-0.88",
  "gyro_z": "-0.75",
  "key_2": "0",
  "key_1": "0",
  "compass_x": "0.00",
  "object_temp": "27.38",
  "compass_y": "0.00",
  "compass_z": "0.00",
  "acc_z": "-0.95",
  "acc_y": "0.01",
  "acc_x": "-0.02",
  "air_pressure": "894.03",
  "reed_relay": "0",
  "light": "346.72"
} 

...exactly as provided by the SensorTag.

The app is now configurable so the web site may be selected by you.  Use the configure button on your phone to change the URL from which it fetches data.  Default is my app which sees data from my SensorTag.

Up/Down buttons cycle through the available data.  Select refreshes.  Data will only change when my SensorTag is on & connected to IBM BlueMix!

data.author: Cody Doremus

changelog.release_notes: Reduced size of messages between watch and phone which is now allowing the Timestamp to the Timeline to work on the original Pebble!
Added a minute count since the last timestamp in the top right corner in a small unobtrusive font. It should get to 9999 before running out of room.

Added voice dictation to control the label for the list and timeline pins if you have a PebbleTime! There is a 5th menu option to turn this OFF or ON. It will default to ON so current users know it is available. 
There is no prompt before it shows up since the idea of the app is to log the current time as fast as possible.

Added sending worthless data from the watch to the phone because updated Pebble Time software would not send blank data. This allows the timestamp request to get to the phone and pin to the timeline again.
Bug fix: Properly checking if images exist so I don't make double and I only delete created images.
Reduced Stampete from 50 to 49 for the stamp time. Large 24 hour Timestamps were getting cut off.
Window did not initialize correctly after start new list with current. Going back to main screen to force the Window update.

Added support for black and white pebble! Now they can have all the Timestamp goodness using the list. Full support is included for when the firmware/os is updated to support the timeline.

List now supports 50 items! I don't plan on making it more than that because do you really want to scroll through that many entries? Fixed the logic error where once the list was full the timestamp you just took would not show up until the next time you took a timestamp.

Spruced up the list of icons on Pebble Time to have an orange background and the status bar from black and white pebble.
Realized I was inconsistent with my wording on the menu options. Changed "Stamp" to "Timestamp" to be less confusing. I originally thought I did not have enough characters.

Added options to manage your list of Timestamps!
You can now delete a single entry, start a new list with the stamp you created going into the app (The "Uh oh, I wanted this to be the first entry" option. I suspect this will be the most used), create a new stamp without exiting the app, or Delete Your Entire List and start over!

Recorded calling the Timestamp prior to updating the time so the seconds in the stamp would be more accurate.

Added seconds to the list view in the app. Seconds will not show up on the pin for the timeline.
Increased list to 35 values. Fixed logic error causing current entry to not show on the list.

Option to clear list still planned...

Added a menu list to see your last 31 timestamps. This will be updated when you load the app independent of if the Timestamp pin was successfully sent to your Timeline. Once you hit 31 stamps the oldest will be replaced. In the next version I plan to add a way to reset this list. 

Bug fix to update battery level on load. 

Attempt at fixing multiple timestamps from the java on the phone resetting. If it resets just right you can still get double Timeline stamps, but not on the app list!

Added better error handling. You will have to wait longer to see the "STAMPED TO TIMELINE" but it should be right. 
If the java on your phone resets itself and breaks you will see nothing for an extended period of time.
If the pin process goes badly and it knows it you will get "STAMP ERROR."

You may still have to wait a bit for the timeline pin to show on your timeline even after a successful send. The official pebble documentation on a timeline pin showing up is: "it could take up to 15 minutes, but it is usually much faster than that."

added stamPete font with permission from Joe Bob Graphics. www.joebob.nl

Stamp will now cycle between the two fonts! Maybe more are to come...

Rearranged UI again with a more readable rubber stamp looking font. As a side effect of changing the way the stamp time is calculated it gets a cool delay that looks like someone is stamping it after the rest of the UI updates. Nice.

Using Dirty Ego font by Misprinted Type
http://www.fontspace.com/misprinted-type/dirty-ego

Added a stamp looking font for Stamped time and text. Got rid of star notification. "STAMPED to Timeline" now appears to confirm that the pin was saved (happens before the time updates for me...).
Accompanying pictures and screenshots to be updated tonight.
Changed battery icon  to be red and less filled to indicate LOW battery.
Officially labeled release. See 0.5 for details on what is actually in this thing.

Will not work with this file due to needing to publish to get the UUID...
Initial Release:

Save a time stamp nearly instantly by entering the app. Notification icon returned from .js once pin is requested.
App contains fully functional watchface with a BIG font to show the time the app was entered and the current time. Bluetooth icon and short, long, short vibration if bluetooth is disconnected. Battery icon if Battery is 20% or below.

Current background color is GColorChromeYellow because I like orange.

Free font for time is VCR_OSD_MONO.
Text uses system fonts.
Currently only in English. If someone has a better international way to designate which time is which I might change this in the future.

If anybody reads release notes I do respond to email and suggestions.
Make it a great day!

data.description:
Save a Timestamp of the current time to the timeline just by entering the app! Set a button shortcut for one button logging. Use the microphone to label your Timestamp! (option to turn OFF)

"STAMPED TO TIMELINE" will show up after the timeline pin request is sent (it might take a bit). It may take a few seconds to 15 min for the pin to actually show on the timeline, but you do not need to remain in the app.

You can stay in the app for the Timestamp list and a fully functional watchface with a bluetooth disconnect warning (short long short vibration and icon) and low battery warning (icon @ 20% or below). In a BIG monospaced font you will see the current time above the Timestamp (rubber stamp font, get it?).

The minutes since you stamped will show at the top.

Use your pebble for other tasks, go to the past timeline or the list in the app to see your Timestamp. 

Why would you use this?

Keep track of fuzzy timing: At bedtime you tell your child you will stay 5 more minutes. You look at your watch. Several minutes later you look at your watch but can't remember what time it was the first time.

Leave a breadcrumb trail of time.  Like when you take your ibuprofen, track potty training... The last 50 Timestamps are saved in a list. Use the options to manage your list.

Create your own use case with this simple tool at your finger tips (literally)!

Note: Past Timeline remembers 24-48 hours. App remembers last 50 timestamps.

Font
Dirty Ego-MisprintedType
stamPete-http://www.joebob.nl
VCR OSD Mono-Riciery Leal

Give it a heart of you like it!

This is my fan remake of one of my all time favourite games from 1983 now ready to play on all Pebble watches (including Round).

This is the first game I've ever coded for any platform. I've drawn all the graphics pixel by pixel and tried to make the gameplay as authentic as possible.

What's working:
Player moves & shoots
Enemies move & shoot
Collision detection
Level/Enemy speed up every 100 points (20 enemies)
Enemies explode

Still to do:
Menus / Game over (restart)
Make middle enemies move sideways
Enemy double shots
Bonus level (4 fast moving enemies worth 50 points after each level)
Extra life every 1000 points
Possible future additions:

data.description:
You are too smoking! Quit it.

Simply press the up button every time you smoke. If you get a craving press the select button to start a delay time and hold out as long as you can. If you make it 15 mins then you meet the goal.

Best - Shows longest time from the delay timer until you smoked.
Last - Shows time since last smoke had.
Goal Met - Count of times made it past 15 mins on delay timer.

Press select to start a delay timer when a craving hits. Try to meet you goal. Hold select to stop delay timer.

Press up to count one smoke. This will automatically clear the delay timer and set the timer since last smoke. 

Hold up to enable adding a timeline pin every time a smoke is logged. A T should appear on the screen.

Press down to decrement number of smokes down by one.
Hold down to clear the days smoke number to zero. Count automatically resets to zero on the next day.

data.description:
This app displays your local weather radar. It uses Weather Underground for its data. You will need to get a free key from them to use this app. You can get your key at http://api.wunderground.com/api.

When the apps loads it will display the current radar. Press the middle button to see the past 4 radars and the current radar in animation. Please note this is not stored it goes to WU each time. A short press of the top button will go back one radar frame. A long press will increase the zoom by 10 and reload the current radar. A short press of the down button will go forward one radar frame. A long press will decrease the zoom by 10 and reload the current radar. 

Enter the WU key and default zoom level on the configuration page.

If you like this app please heart it.

latest_release.release_notes: Improved memory use.

data.title: Weather Radar

data.description:
Scalerometer is a novel app which lets you weigh things using only the accelerometer in Pebble. A scale on your wrist!

How it works:
The app works by detecting how fast you can oscillate a certain object. The heavier an object is, the slower you will be able to swing it up and down which can be detected using the accelerometer.
The accuracy greatly depends on your ability to use a constant effort when calibrating and weighing objects. Make sure you use the same force for all weights instead of trying to oscillate even heavy weights as fast as possible.

To extend the range that can be weighed, it is usually best to start with your empty hand and swing as fast as you can, then keep the same force for higher weights. You need to calibrate with at least 3 different known weights!

data.description:
Colorpick is a tool for Pebble Time developer. The tool helps you to decide which color match together. And it helps you to evaluate the differences beween color display on the computer screen and the Pebble Time display.

Using:
You can implement the shown color numbers in your app with this code:
(GColor8){.argb=((uint8_t)(0xC0|number))}

+UP-Button: increases number
+DOWN-Button: decreases number
+SELECT-Button: holds the actual color and the next four colors in the row on top in the info space
+2x SELECT-Button: hold the complement and the next four colors in the row on top in the info space

latest_release.release_notes: Now using the Dithering Library by MathewReiss.

data.description:
Timeline Tag is a multiplayer game, played entirely within the Pebble Timeline!

To join the game, simply open the app. Shortly after starting, you will receive your first tag within your timeline. This first tag will be easy to find, the subsequent ones slightly less so.... The tag will report your current score and rank. When you receive it, it will give you a selection of recipients to send the tag to. When you select a recipient, the tag will be sent to them, and you will be awarded the points value of the tag. 

Tags start out worth 1 point, and their points value increments each time the tag is sent to a recipient. The more a tag is forwarded on, the higher it's points value, so make sure you keep forwarding them on! 

The tags will arrive silently to some point on the timeline, so you'll have to keep an eye out to make sure you don't miss any. Any tags that drop off your timeline without being forwarded on will die. 

Hint: Look out for your own ID in the recipients list for the tag - you could get more points by sending it back to yourself to do it all again! 

IMPORTANT: Timeline Tag requires an active internet connection, so if you do not receive your starting tag, ensure that you open the app when you have a good internet connection and wait until the first tag arrives.

latest_release.release_notes: Emery support

data.title: Timeline Tag!

data.description:
ChinaStock is a watch app for tracking stock information in Chinese stock markets. It only supports Chinese language right now. Please set the system language to Simplified Chinese first to use the watch app. 
ChinaStock是专门针对中国用户的股票查询Pebble应用。 使用前请先将Pebble手表的语言设置为中文，因为股票的名称都是以中文显示的，否则会出现乱码。  使用说明： 第一次打开，请按手表屏幕提示在手机上的Pebble应用里对手表app进行配置。以后也可以随时进行配置，更改关注的股票或者指数的代码。
配置方法：点击对应的Settings按钮会打开一个配置网页，里面可以设置您要关注的股票或者指数的代码。请按页面里要求的格式输入。 
手表app的使用方法： 在第一个列表页，上下键选择项目，确定键进入项目详情，长按确定键刷新列表。 在详情页，上下键翻页，确定键刷新数据，返回键返回到列表页。
欢迎大家多提意见和建议，我会把它做得越来越好的。谢谢支持和鼓励！

data.description:
With Swift Finder, you can QUICKLY find your iPhone right from Pebble Watch! Simply raise your wrist, launch "Swift Finder" from your Pebble Watch, and press select button, your phone will start ringing LOUDLY till you find it.

No matter where you left your iPhone, even if it is under a pile of clothes, in silent mode or has headset plugged in, Swift Finder will help you find it quickly by yourself because the phone will keep ringing at loudest volume until you find it. With the Swift Finder, never be stressed again wandering around to find your iPhone.

Swift Finder app on iPhone can also help you QUICKLY find your Pebble Watch. When tapping “Find” button in the companion app, your Pebble Watch will start vibrating to get your attention. The app will also track last seen location of the watch in background when the watch is out of range, and send you notification when your lost watch is back in range.

Our iOS companion app can also help find your car or anything else. Download our companion app to try these features out.

Features:
- Find iPhone quickly right from your Pebble Watch with single button click
- LOUDEST volume from phone speaker, even if in silent mode or has headset plugged in
- Keep ringing until you found it

- Find Pebble Watch from your iPhone
- Track last seen location of your Pebble Watch
- Notify you when lost Pebble Watch is back in range

data.description:
Visually-impaired friendly watchapp that tells the arrival times of buses at the bus stop you're at using vibrations.

Usage:

Selecting the bus: Up / Down - Select the current digit of the bus number. The number of vibrations that follows is the currently displayed number.

Select - Move on to the next digit, starting from 0. If there are already 3 digits, this confirms the bus number.

(Long press) Select - Confirm the bus number.

Selecting bus stop, before selecting bus number:
(Long press) Up / Down - Go up or down the list of 10 nearest bus stops, displayed at the top of the screen. The closest bus stop is selected by default. 

(Long press) Select - Refresh bus timing.

data.description:
The official Uber app is here!

The Uber app gets you where you need to go right from your wrist. With the press of a button, you can request an Uber to your location, set a favorite destination, and watch your car arrive, all without taking out your phone. Once you’ve gotten there, check out all the rides you’ve taken on your timeline.

Product features:
- Configure favorite locations for pickup and dropoff
- Set your pickup location to either your current location or one of your favorites 
- Choose from a list of standard uber products
- Confirm / accept surge pricing if it occurs in your area
- Set a destination from your favorite locations
- Request an Uber product
- Track the car on the map as it arrives
- See time to arrival on your timeline
- See all the rides you've taken in your past timeline
***** Quick order: long press the middle button from the first screen to immediately order the same kind of car you ordered last to your current location

data.description:
A port of the famous Threes game on the Pebble.

Features :
- Uses all four buttons (BACK for left, SELECT for right, UP for up, DOWN for down, long press SELECT to exit the app).
- The colored square in the bottom right indicates what the next kind of tile that will spawn is.
- Saves the progress when you exit and resumes any save when you launch the app again.
- Keeps track of your best score.

Don't hesitate to make any suggestion or criticism !

(Note : Do not use a long press on the back button to close the app, it will simply kill the app and won't save your progress. Instead, use the long press on the select button, this way your progress is saved and resumed when you start the app again.)

Simple time tracking program for up to five projects.  You can edit the project names and times using "Settings" on the phone.  It's ok to run a different application while a project is being tracked and it's ok to assign time to multiple projects at once.  (Resetting to zero is done on the phone so it can't be done accidentally.)

data.description: Simple time tracking program for up to five projects. You can edit the project names and times using "Settings" on the phone. It's ok to run a different application while a project is being tracked and it's ok to assign time to multiple projects at once. Resetting to zero can be done by holding down the middle button for 1 second.  The program also tracks the bluetooth connection and displays a bluetooth symbol (with a buzz) when signal status changes.

data.description:
Going flying today? Put a TAF report on your wrist!

TAFline pushes TAF report pins into your Pebble Timeline. Not only will you get the weather forecast, but we calculate the flight rules. Icons and background make it simple to know when your flight might become IFR. Made by a pilot for pilots.

Open the settings to set a station or use the nearest one. Then launch the app. That's it! Old pins will automatically be replaced if a new report is issued or the station is changed when the app is opened again.

Updated 2016-02-13:
Now available on the Pebble Round

Ties into avwx.rest, my METAR and TAF parsing API.
Note: Flight rules are determined by the prior conditions if not all info is present in the associated report.
    1: IFR - 9999 BKN009
    2: IFR - TEMPO 7000 (BKN009)
Pins will appear as soon as your timeline syncs.

Probably the last update before Pebble clouds shut down. What's new:
Input text-notes with a T3 keyboard (https://github.com/vgmoose/tertiary_text thanks!), mark down cards and subs directly at your wrist. Configure settings from your phone and get a complete match report. Watch vibrates every 15 secs while paused: no more forgetting to restart.

A complete timer for Rugby referees.

(*) Sections of code courtesy of Simon Taylor, Ambient Power

Cycle through items with select button. Long select/Back to enter/exit settings screen.
Main window to show and operate timers for period, next expring card and injury as well as score summary.
Settings screen for times durations. A scrollable time-line of the match events is also displayed.

data.description:
Description
A complete timer for Rugby referees. (*) Sections of code courtesy of Simon Taylor, Ambient Power Main Window (cycle through items with select button): - Period timer showing time elapsed and left. - Cards/Injuries timer (configurable duration): can store up to 10 cards/injuries and shows the next expiring ones. Injury timers run with real time, i.e. even when the match clock is paused. - Scores: you can scroll between the different score types (try/conv/pen/drop) to add a score and besides the total score the amounts of the single score types are shown as well (i.e. how many tries/convs/pens/drops). Undo last entry of a team with long press. - Information: shows information and instructions for a given mode. Settings screen (cycle through items with select button): - Can be accessed with select long-press and exited with back button. - Match period duration: you can increase/decrease by one minute. The value is persistently stored. - Card duration: same as above. - Injury duration: same as above. - History: here you can see a time-log of all events registered during the match (scores/cards/injuries/end-of-period). Only four are shown but you can scroll among them with the buttons. Clock still runs even upon exiting the app and automatically warns whenever a timer expires.

latest_release.release_notes:
- Bug fixes.
- Now available on GitHub: github.com/andrea-sacchetti/Rugby_Referee
- Note: for the new notes-taking feature press the down button while in timer mode.

data.description: Sprint Racer is a fast paced F1 style 2D racing game where you race against 3 computer controlled opponents. The game offers two racing modes: Single Race or Tournament. Single Race Mode allows you to play just a single level. Tournament Mode puts you in a competition against the opponents as you race through each track and accumulate points. The game also keeps track of your high score for the Tournament Mode. You can select the color of your car from a variety of options. The controls are very simple: SELECT starts the race and fires your weapon, DOWN turns the car counterclockwise and UP turns the car clockwise (UP and DOWN can be reversed in the Settings menu).

data.description:
Liveblog tracker for Pebble Time, utilizing the new Timeline functionality.

1. Before (or during) a live event, install the app on your Pebble Time.
2. Once the app is installed on your Pebble Time, open it. It should say "Subscribed".
3. Now, just wait for updates!
4. They will show up as past updates, so click the up button on the right side of your Pebble Time.
5. Only one card will be pushed for a live event, but it will update continuously.
6. Click the middle button on your Pebble Time, and voila!
7. Tip: You can keep the card open on your Pebble Time, as it updates itself! Cool, right?
Because of Pebble Time's e-paper screen, keeping the display on won't drain your battery.

Open-Source on GitHub.

latest_release.release_notes: Initial Release

Water Pilot is designed for boaters, by boaters, to give you all of your GPS navigation information on your phone and watch.

With Water Pilot, you can keep your phone somewhere safe and dry onboard, and be able to rely on your waterproof Pebble smart watch for all of your navigation information.

data.description:
Keeping track of your performance while playing basketball has never been easier.
Register points, rebounds and assists and try to earn a triple-double like your favourite NBA star.

Function:
- Points: UP 
- Rebounds: SELECT
- Assists: DOWN
- 3 pointer: UP-(longpress)
- Block: SELECT-(longpress)
- Steal: DOWN-(longpress)

data.description:
8-A-Day is a timeline Watchapp that reminds you to drink 8 glasses of water a day.

At 9am, reminders to drink water will start to appear in your timeline. Then at 8pm, a daily summary will be found that tells you how many glasses of water you drank during the day. Simply start the app, and everything will be set up automatically. 

Each reminder notification has two options: 
'Yes' increments your daily count and creates another reminder in an hour on your timeline.
'No' postpones the current reminder by 15 minutes.

IMPORTANT: 8-A-Day requires an active internet connection, so if you do not receive your reminders or the timezone doesn't sync, ensure you have a good internet connection before you open the app and wait for 30-60 seconds to ensure the sync is a success. (Don't worry, once it's set up you don't need to do this again until your timezone changes!)
